00035 #include <string>

00051 namespace {
00052     // FuncTable - table of pre-defined functions
00053     class FuncTable {
00054     public:
00055         void define(const char* name, SeExprFunc f,const char* docString=0) {
00056             if(docString) funcmap[name] = FuncMapItem(std::string(docString),f); 
00057             else funcmap[name] = FuncMapItem(name,f); 
00058         }
00059 
00060         const SeExprFunc* lookup(const std::string& name)
00061         {
00062             FuncMap::iterator iter;
00063             if ((iter = funcmap.find(name)) != funcmap.end())
00064                 return &iter->second.second;
00065             return 0;
00066         }
00067         void initBuiltins();
00068 
00069         void getFunctionNames(std::vector<std::string>& names)
00070         {
00071             for(FuncMap::iterator i=funcmap.begin();i!=funcmap.end();++i)
00072                 names.push_back(i->first);
00073         }
00074 
00075         std::string getDocString(const char* functionName)
00076         {
00077             FuncMap::iterator i=funcmap.find(functionName);
00078             if(i==funcmap.end()) return "";
00079             else return i->second.first;
00080         }
00081         
00082     private:
00083         typedef std::pair<std::string,SeExprFunc> FuncMapItem;
00084         typedef std::map<std::string,FuncMapItem> FuncMap;
00085         FuncMap funcmap;
00086     };
00087 
00088     FuncTable* Functions = 0;
00089 }
00090 
00091 
00092 bool SeExprFuncX::prep(SeExprFuncNode* node, bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00093 {
00094     /* call base node prep by default:
00095        this passes wantVec to all the children and sets isVec true if any
00096        child is a vec */
00097     return node->SeExprNode::prep(wantVec, error);
00098 }

00100 
00101 static SeExprInternal::Mutex mutex;
00102 
00103 void SeExprFunc::init()
00104 {
00105     SeExprInternal::AutoMutex locker(mutex);
00106     initInternal();
00107 }
00108 
00109 const SeExprFunc*
00110 SeExprFunc::lookup(const std::string& name)
00111 {
00112     mutex.lock();
00113     if (!Functions) initInternal();
00114     const SeExprFunc* ret=Functions->lookup(name);
00115     mutex.unlock();
00116     return ret;
00117 }
00118     
00119 inline static void 
00120 defineInternal(const char* name,SeExprFunc f)
00121 {
00122     // THIS FUNCTION IS NOT THREAD SAFE, it assumes you have a mutex from callee
00123     // ALSO YOU MUST BE VERY CAREFUL NOT TO CALL ANYTHING THAT TRIES TO REACQUIRE MUTEX!
00124     Functions->define(name,f);
00125 }
00126 
00127 inline static void 
00128 defineInternal3(const char* name,SeExprFunc f,const char* docString)
00129 {
00130     // THIS FUNCTION IS NOT THREAD SAFE, it assumes you have a mutex from callee
00131     // ALSO YOU MUST BE VERY CAREFUL NOT TO CALL ANYTHING THAT TRIES TO REACQUIRE MUTEX!
00132     Functions->define(name,f,docString);
00133 }
00134 
00135 void SeExprFunc::initInternal()
00136 {
00137     // THIS FUNCTION IS NOT THREAD SAFE, it assumes you have a mutex from callee
00138     // ALSO YOU MUST BE VERY CAREFUL NOT TO CALL ANYTHING THAT TRIES TO REACQUIRE MUTEX!
00139 
00140     // TODO: make thread safe
00141     if (Functions) return;
00142     Functions = new FuncTable;
00143     SeExpr::defineBuiltins(defineInternal,defineInternal3);
00144     const char* path = getenv("SE_EXPR_PLUGINS");
00145     if (path) loadPlugins(path);
00146 }
00147 
00148 void
00149 SeExprFunc::define(const char* name, SeExprFunc f)
00150 {
00151     mutex.lock();
00152     if (!Functions) initInternal();
00153     defineInternal(name,f);
00154     mutex.unlock();
00155 }
00156 
00157 void
00158 SeExprFunc::define(const char* name, SeExprFunc f,const char* docString)
00159 {
00160     mutex.lock();
00161     if (!Functions) initInternal();
00162     defineInternal3(name,f,docString);
00163     mutex.unlock();
00164 }
00165 
00166 void 
00167 SeExprFunc::getFunctionNames(std::vector<std::string>& names)
00168 {
00169     mutex.lock();
00170     if(!Functions) initInternal();
00171     Functions->getFunctionNames(names);
00172     mutex.unlock();
00173 }
00174 
00175 std::string
00176 SeExprFunc::getDocString(const char* functionName)
00177 {
00178     mutex.lock();
00179     if(!Functions) initInternal();
00180     std::string ret=Functions->getDocString(functionName);
00181     mutex.unlock();
00182     return ret;
00183 }

00185 #ifndef SEEXPR_WIN32
00186 
00187 #ifdef __APPLE__
00188 static int MatchPluginName(struct dirent* dir)
00189 #else
00190 static int MatchPluginName(const struct dirent* dir)
00191 #endif
00192 {
00193     const char* name = dir->d_name;
00194     // return true if name matches SeExpr*.so
00195     return 
00196         !strncmp(name, "SeExpr", 6) &&
00197         !strcmp(name + strlen(name) - 3, ".so");
00198 }
00199 #endif
00200 
00201 
00202 void
00203 SeExprFunc::loadPlugins(const char* path)
00204 {
00205 #ifdef SEEXPR_WIN32
00206 
00207 #else
00208     // first split path into individual entries
00209     char* pathdup = strdup(path);
00210     char* state = 0;
00211     char* entry = strtok_r(pathdup, ":", &state);
00212     while (entry) {
00213         // if entry ends with ".so", load directly
00214         if ((!strcmp(entry+strlen(entry)-3, ".so")))
00215             loadPlugin(entry);
00216         else {
00217             // assume it's a dir - search it for plugins
00218             struct dirent** matches = 0;
00219             int numMatches = scandir(entry, &matches, MatchPluginName, alphasort);
00220             for (int i = 0; i < numMatches; i++) {
00221                 std::string fullpath = entry; fullpath += "/"; 
00222                 fullpath += matches[i]->d_name;
00223                 loadPlugin(fullpath.c_str());
00224             }
00225             if (matches) free(matches);
00226             else {
00227                 std::cerr << "No plugins found matching "
00228                           << path << "/SeExpr*.so" << std::endl;
00229             }
00230         }
00231 
00232         entry = strtok_r(0, ":", &state);
00233     }
00234     free(pathdup);
00235 #endif
00236 }
00237 
00238 void
00239 SeExprFunc::loadPlugin(const char* path)
00240 {
00241 #ifdef SEEXPR_WIN32
00242     std::cerr<<"SeExpr: warning Plugins are not supported on windows currently"<<std::endl;
00243 #else
00244     void* handle = dlopen(path, RTLD_LAZY);
00245     if (!handle) {
00246         std::cerr << "Error reading expression plugin: " << path << std::endl;
00247         const char* err = dlerror();
00248         if (err) std::cerr << err << std::endl;
00249         return;
00250     }
00251     typedef void (*initfn_v1) (SeExprFunc::Define);
00252     initfn_v1 init_v1 = (initfn_v1) dlsym(handle, "SeExprPluginInit");
00253     typedef void (*initfn_v2) (SeExprFunc::Define3);
00254     initfn_v2 init_v2 = (initfn_v2) dlsym(handle, "SeExprPluginInitV2");
00255 
00256     if(init_v2) init_v2(defineInternal3);
00257     else if(init_v1) init_v1(defineInternal);
00258     else{
00259         std::cerr << "Error reading expression plugin: " << path << std::endl;
00260         std::cerr << "No function named SeExprPluginInit or SeExprPluginInitV2 found" << std::endl;
00261         dlclose(handle);
00262         return;
00263     }
00264 #endif
00265 }
